headline: Baker Hughes deal, UPS guidance, SoFi Q2 beat: Trending Tickers
summary: Baker Hughes (BKR) is acquiring cryogenic equipment maker Chart Industries (GTLS) in a $13.6 billion deal, signaling further consolidation in the oilfield services space. UPS (UPS) stock slumps after the company reported mixed quarterly results and declined to offer full-year guidance, citing macroeconomic uncertainty. SoFi (SOFI) stock is soaring after the company reported a strong earnings beat, with revenue surging 44% year over year and the company adding a record 850,000 new members in the quarter. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

content.title: Baker Hughes deal, UPS guidance, SoFi Q2 beat: Trending Tickers
content.description:
Baker Hughes (BKR) is acquiring cryogenic equipment maker Chart Industries (GTLS) in a $13.6 billion deal, signaling further consolidation in the oilfield services space.

UPS (UPS) stock slumps after the company reported mixed quarterly results and declined to offer full-year guidance, citing macroeconomic uncertainty.

SoFi (SOFI) stock is soaring after the company reported a strong earnings beat, with revenue surging 44% year over year and the company adding a record 850,000 new members in the quarter.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.
content.summary: Baker Hughes (BKR) is acquiring cryogenic equipment maker Chart Industries (GTLS) in a $13.6 billion deal, signaling further consolidation in the oilfield services space. UPS (UPS) stock slumps after the company reported mixed quarterly results and declined to offer full-year guidance, citing macroeconomic uncertainty. SoFi (SOFI) stock is soaring after the company reported a strong earnings beat, with revenue surging 44% year over year and the company adding a record 850,000 new members in the quarter. headline: Chart (NYSE:GTLS) Misses Q2 Sales Targets, But Stock Soars 16.5%
summary: Gas handling company Chart (NYSE:GTLS) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025 as sales rose 4% year on year to $1.08 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.59 per share was 3.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Chart (NYSE:GTLS) Misses Q2 Sales Targets, But Stock Soars 16.5%
content.summary: Gas handling company Chart (NYSE:GTLS) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025 as sales rose 4% year on year to $1.08 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.59 per share was 3.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Baker Hughes bets on LNG, data center demand with $13.6 billion Chart Industries deal
summary: (Reuters) -Oilfield services firm Baker Hughes said on Tuesday it would buy Chart Industries in a $13.6 billion all-cash deal, including debt, topping a previously-agreed merger offer that Chart struck with rival Flowserve last month.  The deal will give Baker Hughes greater exposure to industrial technology servicing liquefied natural gas and data centers, at a time when American energy exports and digital infrastructure growth are garnering huge interest from companies and investors.  It forms part of Baker Hughes' efforts to leverage its industrial and energy technology portfolio, which helped boost second-quarter earnings, and continues a rebalancing of its business away from its traditional oilfield services focus.

content.title: Baker Hughes bets on LNG, data center demand with $13.6 billion Chart Industries deal
content.summary: (Reuters) -Oilfield services firm Baker Hughes said on Tuesday it would buy Chart Industries in a $13.6 billion all-cash deal, including debt, topping a previously-agreed merger offer that Chart struck with rival Flowserve last month.  The deal will give Baker Hughes greater exposure to industrial technology servicing liquefied natural gas and data centers, at a time when American energy exports and digital infrastructure growth are garnering huge interest from companies and investors.  It forms part of Baker Hughes' efforts to leverage its industrial and energy technology portfolio, which helped boost second-quarter earnings, and continues a rebalancing of its business away from its traditional oilfield services focus.

headline: Flowserve Corporation Terminates Merger with Chart Industries
summary: DALLAS, July 29, 2025--Flowserve Corporation (NYSE: FLS) ("Flowserve"), a leading provider of flow control products and services for the global infrastructure markets, today announced it has terminated its previously announced merger agreement for Flowserve to combine with Chart Industries, Inc. (NYSE: GTLS) ("Chart").
